org.mellowtech.core.bytestorable

Class CBCharArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mellowtech.core.bytestorable.BStorableImp<char[],CBCharArray>
      • org.mellowtech.core.bytestorable.CBCharArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CharSequence, Comparable<CBCharArray>, BComparable<char[],CBCharArray>, BStorable<char[],CBCharArray>

    public class CBCharArray
extends BStorableImp<char[],CBCharArray>
implements BComparable<char[],CBCharArray>, CharSequence
    CBChars is binary compatible with CBString, that is, it encodes its chars to utf8. CBChars allows for comparison on a byte level, i.e. directly comparing the UTF-8 encoded characters. The main difference between CBChars and CBString is that CBChars stores it's in-memory characters directly as a string which increase performance in certain situations when doing heavy sorting that relies on compareTo

    The CBChars can be used with a CompiledLocale to get correct comparison of Strings at a language specific level.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin Svensson, msvens@gmail.com

      • byteCompare

        public int byteCompare(int offset1,
                       byte[] b1,
                       int offset2,
                       byte[] b2)
        Description copied from interface: BComparable
        Compares two objects that are represented as bytes in a byte arrays. Default implementation wraps the byte arrays to ByteBuffers and calls byteCompare(offset1, ByteBuffer.wrap(b1), offset2, ByteBuffer.wrap(b2)
        Specified by:
        byteCompare in interface BComparable<char[],CBCharArray>
        Parameters:
        offset1 - the offset in the buffer for the first object
        b1 - array that holds the first object
        offset2 - the offset in the buffer for the second object
        b2 - array that holds the second object
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as the first argument is less than, equal to, or greater than the second.
